REQ-001.title: Override Identity
REQ-001.statement: Every override MUST have a unique, stable identifier that persists across system restarts and data synchronization.

mapping_refs.context:
es |
|-------------|--------|-------|
| REQ-001: Override Identity | ✅ | Uses MongoDB _

REQ-002.title: Override Supersession Tracking
REQ-002.statement: When an override is superseded, the system MUST record: 1. The ID of the superseding override 2. The timestamp of supersession 3. Update the status to "superseded"

ide Identity | ✅ | Uses MongoDB _id |

REQ-003.title: Override Status Transitions
REQ-003.statement: Override status MUST follow valid transitions: - `active` → `completed` (duration elapsed) - `active` → `cancelled` (user cancellation) - `active` → `superseded` (new override activated)

mapping_refs.context:
sion Tracking | ❌ | Not implemented |
| REQ-003: Override Status Transitions | 🟡 | Impl

REQ-010.title: UTC Timestamps
REQ-010.statement: All timestamps MUST be in ISO 8601 format with UTC timezone (Z suffix or +00:00).

REQ-020.title: Event Immutability
REQ-020.statement: Once created, the core identity and timestamp of an event MUST NOT be modified. Only status and relationship fields may be updated.

REQ-030.title: Sync Identity Preservation
REQ-030.statement: When uploading data to Nightscout, the system MUST include a client-generated identifier that survives the upload/download round-trip.

REQ-031.title: Self-Entry Exclusion
REQ-031.statement: When downloading treatments, the system SHOULD exclude entries it previously uploaded to avoid duplicate processing.

REQ-032.title: Incremental Sync Support
REQ-032.statement: The system SHOULD support incremental synchronization using server-provided modification timestamps (`srvModified`).

REQ-033.title: Server Deduplication
REQ-033.statement: When receiving a POST for a document that matches existing deduplication criteria, the server MUST return the existing document with HTTP 200 (not create a duplicate with 201).

REQ-034.title: Cross-Controller Coexistence
REQ-034.statement: Multiple controllers MUST be able to upload data to the same Nightscout instance without interfering with each other's records.

REQ-035.title: Conflict Detection
REQ-035.statement: When updating a document, the system SHOULD support optimistic concurrency via `If-Unmodified-Since` header, returning HTTP 412 if document was modified by another client.

REQ-040.title: Bolus Amount Preservation
REQ-040.statement: When syncing a bolus treatment, the `insulin` amount MUST be preserved exactly (to 0.01U precision) during upload and download.

REQ-041.statement: When syncing a carb treatment, the `carbs` amount MUST be preserved exactly (to 0.1g precision) during upload and download.

REQ-043.statement: When uploading an automatic bolus (SMB or auto-bolus), the system MUST set `automatic: true` to distinguish from manual boluses.

REQ-046.title: Absorption Time Unit Conversion
REQ-046.statement: When uploading carb entries with absorption time, the system MUST convert from internal units (typically seconds) to Nightscout's expected unit (minutes).
